title: Albania - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 2 February 2021, residents of the surrounding villages protested near Maliq over the collapse of the main road that connects them, demanding its reconstruction. [size=no report]
On 26 January 2021, dozens of residents of the village protested in Rrogozhine against the lack of roads and infrastructure connecting their neighborhoods to the village center. [size=dozens]
On 16 January 2021, residents of the village briefly blocked part of the National Highway passing in Munaz. The police intervened and arrested 8 protesters. [size=no report]
On 11 January 2021, primary school students protested in Bradashesh against the lack of heating in their school. [size=no report]
On 11 January 2021, land owners protested in Fier against the expropriation of their land for the construction of a hospital. [size=no report]
On 8 January 2021, residents of the village protested in Theth against the electricity shortages and communications problems that resulted from a snow storm. [size=no report]

On 6 January 2021, Albanian police detained six people during a protest outside of the government headquarters in Tirana. The demonstrators were demanding more transparency in the maritime border negotiations with Greece. [size=no report]
On 31 December 2020, doctors protested outside the Mother Theresa Hospital in Tirana, demonstrating against the dismissal of their colleague Allkja. [size=no report]
Alliance for Protection of the National Theater

On 22 December 2020, activists from the Alliance for Protection of the National Theater protested in Tirana, demanding the resignation of police chief Veliu. The protest was in response to police violence used against the four detainees days before. [size=no report]
Alliance for Protection of the National Theater

On 21 December 2020, activists from the Alliance for Protection of the National Theater protested in Tirana, demanding the resignation of police chief Veliu. The protest was in response to police violence used against the four detainees days before. [size=no report]
Alliance for Protection of the National Theater

On 20 December 2020, dozens of activists from the Alliance for Protection of the National Theater protested in Tirana, demanding the resignation of police chief Veliu. The protest was in response to police violence used against the four detainees the day before. [size=dozens]
On 20 December 2020, residents of the village protested in Prozhm against the construction of the Durres-Kukes highway. [size=no report]
Alliance for Protection of the National Theater

On 19 December 2020, Albanian police detained for four hours four activists from the Alliance for Protection of the National Theater in Tirana. The activists were allegedly physically and sexually assaulted by the Police.
On 19 December 2020, people protested in Shkoder over the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha. [size=no report]
On 16 December 2020, students protested outside of the Ministry of Education in Tirana, demanding the resignation of Minister Kushi over his recent comments about young people. [size=no report]
On 15 December 2020, people protested in Durres against the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha. Five demonstrators were detained by the police. [size=no report]
On 15 December 2020, people protested in Tirana against the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha, demanding the resignation of Albania's police chief Veliu. [size=no report]
On 14 December 2020, tens of demonstrators protested in Tirana against the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha, demanding the release of those detained by the police. [size=tens]
On 14 December 2020, few hundred demonstrators protested in Tirana over the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha. [size=hundred]
On 13 December 2020, people protested in Shkoder over the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha, demanding the resignation of Albania's police chief . [size=no report]
On 13 December 2020, police used tear gas and water cannons to disperse hundreds of demonstrators in Tirana during a protest over the killing of Klodian Rasha. [size=hundreds]
On 13 December 2020, thousands of people protested in Lushnje over the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha, demanding the resignation of Albania's police chief. [size=thousands]
On 13 December 2020, people protested in Cerrik over the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha, demanding the resignation of Albania's police chief . [size=no report]
On 13 December 2020, people protested in Librazhd over the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha, demanding the resignation of Albania's police chief. [size=no report]
On 13 December 2020, people protested in Rreshen over the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha, demanding the resignation of Albania's police chief . [size=no report]
On 13 December 2020, people protested in Sarande over the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha, demanding the resignation of Albania's police chief. [size=no report]
On 12 December 2020, rioters clashed with police in Elbasan while demonstrating against the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha. [size=no report]

On 12 December 2020, the police used tear gas, pepper spray and water cannons to disperse hundreds of demonstrators in Tirana who protested against the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha. [size=hundreds]

On 12 December 2020, rioters clashed with police in Shkoder while demonstrating against the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha. One police officer was injured, while property damage was caused to the Socialist Party building during the clashes. [size=no report]
On 12 December 2020, dozens of people protested in Durres against the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha. Four people were arrested during the protest. [size=dozens]
On 11 December 2020, rioters set fire to the Christmas tree in Durres while rioting against the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha. [size=no report]
On 11 December 2020, dozens of people protested in Kamez against the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha, demanding the resignation of General Director of the State Police Veliu. [size=dozens]

On 11 December 2020, dozens of rioters demolished a bus stop near the Prime Minister's office in Tirana over the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha. The police used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the rioters. [size=dozens]

On 10 December 2020, rioters clashed with police in Tirana, while demonstrating against the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha. Police used tear gas to disperse the rioters. Two police officers and a journalist were injured. [size=no report]

On 10 December 2020, dozens of rioters clashed with police in Korce, while demonstrating against the recent police killing of Klodian Rasha. They set fire to the municipal building and injured one officer in the demonstration. [size=dozens]
On 9 December 2020, people protested in Durres against the police killing of Klodian Rasha the previous day. [size=no report]

On 9 December 2020, hundreds of rioters clashed with police outside the Prime Minister's office in Tirana, while demonstrating against the police killing of Klodian Rasha the previous day. Police used tear gas to disperse the demonstrators. Eight police officers were reported injured. [size=hundreds]
On 5 December 2020, residents of 15 villages protested in Dropull i Siperm due to the lack of public transport in the area. [size=no report]
On 1 December 2020, demonstrators protested in Fier, demanding the cessation of the construction of the Milot-Fier road. [size=no report]
On 23 November 2020, students protested in Tirana against the coronavirus measure to have online education. [size=no report]
On 14 November 2020, residents of 1 May neighborhood protested in Vlore, demanding reimbursement for the demolished apartments due to the construction of the Lungomare project. [size=no report]
FRPD: Youth Forum of the Democratic Party of Albania

On 9 November 2020, the Democratic Party Youth Forum held a protest outside of the Prime Minister's office in Tirana over the mismanagement of the coronavirus pandemic. The demonstrators lit 599 candles for those who died due to coronavirus. [size=no report]
On 4 November 2020, demonstrators gathered outside the court in Tirana in support of ex-deputy of the Democratic Party, Klevis Balliu. [size=no report]
On 4 November 2020, dozens of students protested in front of the Ministry of Education in Tirana against the new coronavirus measure for online learning. [size=dozens}
On 3 November 2020, students protested across various governmental buildings in Tirana against the new coronavirus measure for online learning. [size=no report]
On 2 November 2020, hundreds of students protested outside several government buildings in Tirana against the new coronavirus measure for online learning. [size=hundreds]
On 30 October 2020, a TNT device exploded outside the house of Albanian journalist Elidon Ndreka in Balldren (Lezhe), inflicting minor damage to the property. No fatalities reported.
On 26 October 2020, dozens of demonstrators gathered outside the oil factory in Ballsh in support of the women workers holding a hunger strike and demanding their unpaid salaries. [size=dozens]

On 22 October 2020, a protest against the company that owns the local landfill was held in Tirana, Albania. Owners of surrounding lands claim their property was taken away without compensation. [size=no report]

On 21 October 2020, a protest against the company that owns the local landfill was held in Tirana, Albania. Owners of surrounding lands claim their property was taken away without compensation. [size=no report]
On 21 October 2020, local residents protested in Durres, Albania, because of frequent flooding, demanding a new sewage system. [size=no report]
PDIU: Party for Justice, Integration and Unity
On 20 October 2020, activists of PDIU protested in Tirana, Albania, against the visit of Greek Foreign Minister. [size=no report]
On 19 October 2020, local residents protested in Lushnje, Albania, against a fish processing factory in that area, complaining of the smells. [size=no report]
On 19 October 2020, local residents protested in Kruje, Albania, because their houses, which were damaged in the earthquake, have still not been reconstructed. [size=no report]
On 14 October 2020, oil workers, who have been on a hunger strike for more than 2 weeks, protested and broke into the company in Ballsh, Albania, demanding unpaid wages. [size=no report]
On 10 October 2020, several hundred oil workers, who have been on a hunger strike for 13 days, and their supporters protested in Ballsh, Albania, due to unpaid wages. [size=several hundred]
On 8 October 2020, around 60 residents of village Nivica protested in front of the court in Gjirokaster, Albania, over a land dispute. [size=around 60]

On 8 October 2020, families of those incarcerated in prison in Peqin, Albania, protested, demanding communication with the prisoners. The prisoners have been on a hunger strike for several days. [size=no report]
Around 7 October 2020, as reported, prisoners in Burrel, Albania, protested and went on a hunger strike demanding better conditions and penal system reform. [size=no report]
Around 7 October 2020, as reported, prisoners in Peqin, Albania, protested and went on a hunger strike demanding better conditions and penal system reform. [size=no report]
Around 7 October 2020, as reported, prisoners in Rec, Albania, protested and went on a hunger strike demanding better conditions and penal system reform. [size=no report]
Around 7 October 2020, as reported, prisoners in Shenkoll, Albania, protested and went on a hunger strike demanding better conditions and penal system reform. [size=no report]
On 7 October 2020, 150 prisoners in Tirana, Albania, protested and went on a hunger strike demanding better conditions and penal system reform. [size=150]
On 6 October 2020, prisoners in Rrogozhine, Albania, protested and went on a hunger strike demanding better conditions and penal system reform. [size=no report]
On 28 September 2020, oil workers protested in Ballsh, Albania, over unpaid wages and subsequently 10 of them went on strike. [size=at least 10]
On 27 September 2020, residents of Selenice, Albania, protested against the cessation of road construction. [size=no report]
On 25 September 2020, oil workers protested in Ballsh, Albania, due to unpaid wages. [size=no report]

On 24 September 2020, doctors protested in Tirana, Albania, demanding higher salaries, better working conditions, and the status of 'martyrs' for those doctors who died working through the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
On 23 September 2020, families of people who disappeared during the communist regime protested in Tirana, Albania, demanding the circumstances of their deaths be investigated. [size=no report]

On 17 September 2020, oil workers from Ballsh protested in Tirana, Albania, because their wages haven't been paid in almost a year. They tried to enter the Ministry of Infrastructure but were stopped by police. Several demonstrators were arrested. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, oil workers protested in Ballsh, Albania, because their wages have not been paid in over a year. They tried to enter the oil plant, but police intervened and stopped them. [size=no report]
On 14 September 2020, dozens of people protested in Tirana, Albania, demanding some 50 Albanian children who are currently in Syrian camps be returned home. [size=dozens]
On 11 September 2020, oil workers protested in Ballsh, Albania, demanding higher wages and better working conditions. [size=no report]
On 3 September 2020, workers of an oil company protested in Ballsh, Albania, over salary demands. [size=no report]

On 1 September 2020, owners of wedding venues protested in Sukth, Albania, because despite trying to respect measures imposed against the coronavirus pandemic, they were still being fined. [size=no report]
On 26 August 2020, oil refinery workers staged a protest in Ballsh, demanding to resume work and to receive their unpaid salaries. [size=no report]

On 21 August 2020, residents staged a protest in Vore against the construction of a road parallel to a highway, which would lead to the destruction of green space and about 70 buildings. [size=no report]
On 20 August 2020, activists stormed into the State Labor Inspectorate and clashed with employees in Tirana, demonstrating against the death of a construction worker. [size=no report]
On 19 August 2020, residents staged a demonstration and clashed with representatives of a company in Bajkaj village, which was planning to open a quarry in nearby Delvina. [size=no report]
On 13 August 2020, dozens of residents staged a protest at Kakavija border crossing with Greece, opposing temporary border closure to slow the spread of the coronavirus. [size=dozens]
On 10 August 2020, residents staged a protest in Durres over lack of government aid after their apartments were damaged by the earthquake of 26 November 2019. [size=no report]

On 28 July 2020, oil refinery employees working for Albpetrol staged a protest outside the office in Patos, demanding to be paid full salary as they work full-time, instead of 40% of their wages, as decided during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
On 24 July 2020, oil refinery workers staged a protest in Ballsh, demanding their pending salaries for the past two months and asked the Ministry of Energy to help them. [size=no report]
On 22 July 2020, musicians and owners of bars and nightclubs staged a protest in Vlore against the government's decision to close bars and nightclubs during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 21 July 2020, musicians clashed with police in front of the Prime Ministry in Tirana during their second demonstration against the government's decision to close bars and nightclubs during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
On 20 July 2020, musicians staged a protest in Tirana against the government's decision to close bars and nightclubs during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 16 July 2020, the Alliance for the Protection of the National Theater held a protest in front of the Special Prosecution premises in Tirana, suspecting that no investigation was carried out into their reports regarding the demolition of the theatre. [size=no report]
On 7 July 2020, employees of Albpetrol staged a protest in Patos, demanding full compensation for their pay during the coronavirus pandemic, as their work had been suspended. [size=no report]

On 3 July 2020, public transport employees held a protest in Tirana, demanding a second stimulus during the coronavirus pandemic, as they cannot fully return to work, and were dispersed by police. [size=no report]

On 29 June 2020, residents held a protest outside the municipality of Durres, demanding faster procedures to rebuild their houses, which were damaged during the earthquake of 26 November 2019. [size=no report]

On 26 June 2020, residents held a protest in front of the City Hall in Vore against plans to rebuild apartment complexes damaged by the earthquake last November, saying the buildings were not seriously damaged. [size=no report]

On 25 June 2020, residents tried to enter City Hall in Vore to demonstrate against plans to rebuild apartment complexes that were damaged by the earthquake last November, saying the buildings were not seriously damaged and were stopped by police. [size=no report]

On 24 June 2020, the measures enacted by the Albanian government to limit the spread of coronavirus expired. A series of measures to stop the spread of the virus will still remain in place, including wearing of masks in certain public spaces and prohibiting of large gatherings.

On 24 June 2020, police arrested 10-15 public transport employees in front of the Ministry of Instrastructure and Energy in Tirana, who demanded financial assistance during the coronavirus pandemic. The protest moved to another location. [size=at least 10-15]

On 24 June 2020, the Alliance for Protection of Theater organized a protest in Tirana against hydro power development in the country, concerned with river pollution, and were dispersed by police due to social distancing norms during the COVID pandemic. [size=no report]
On 23 June 2020, public transport workers held a protest in Fier and demanded to be allowed to return to work during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 23 June 2020, public transport workers held a protest in Vlore and demanded reimbursement of 70% of fuel, forgiveness or postponement of vehicle taxes for this year, as well as the resumption of work with 70% of the capacity during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
On 19 June 2020, employees from a textile factory held a protest in Kavaje over not receiving government aid during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
On 17 June 2020, students held a protest outside the Ministry of Education in Tirana, demanding cancellation of annual fees amidst the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
On 17 June 2020, residents held a protest in Labinot-Fushe against a fish factory called Rozafa, accusing it of land grabbing and polluting the environment. [size=no report]
Koha Jone; Albanian Daily News; Radio and Televizioni Shqiptar

On 17 June 2020, the Urban and Interurban Public Transport Association held a protest outside the Ministry of Infrastructure and Energy in Tirana against the government decision to postpone the reopening of public transport due to the continuing coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
On 17 June 2020, patriots held a protest in Gjirokaster, demanding resignation of the Greek consul, after a Greek minority group burnt the Albanian flag in a video. [size=no report]

On 15 June 2020, high school seniors held a protest outside the Ministry of Education in Tirana, demanding a reevaluation of their Language and Literature exam and lowering the minimum threshold for passing. [size=no report]
Koha Jone; Radio and Televizioni Shqiptar; Albanian Daily News

On 14 June 2020, high school seniors held a protest outside the Ministry of Education in Tirana, demanding a reevaluation of their Language and Literature exam and lowering the minimum threshold for passing. [size=no report]
On 13 June 2020, dozens of landlords clashed with police at Velipoje coastline, resisting the demolition of 24 illegal buildings, which they managed. [size=dozens]
On 13 June 2020, high school seniors held a protest in Fier, demanding their final literature exam to be cancelled, citing difficulties and inconsistencies in its content. [size=no report]

On 13 June 2020, high school seniors held a protest in Tirana, demanding the Ministry of Education to reevaluate their final literature exam and lower the threshold for passing grades, saying the exam was too difficult and different from their curriculum. [size=no report]
On 12 June 2020, hundreds of high school seniors held a protest and threw eggs at the Ministry of Education in Tirana, saying that their final literature exam was 'tough and unclear.' [size=hundreds]
On 12 June 2020, high school seniors held a protest in Berat against their literature exam, which was too difficult and demanded increase in university quotas. [size=no report]

On 12 June 2020, employees of the Ballsh Oil Processing Plant held a protest in Ballsh, demanding resumption of work at the plant, as its privatization process had left them out of work. [size=no report]

On 11 June 2020, landlords clashed with police, who used tear gas to disperse them, at Velipoje coastline, resisting the demolition of illegal buildings, which they managed. One landlord was injured. [size=no report]

On 11 June 2020, travel agency employees held a protest outside the Ministry of Tourism in Tirana, demanding government relief to overcome the economic loss incurred during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 10 June 2020, the Association of Albanian Public Transport organized a protest outside the Ministry of Transport in Tirana, demanding help during the coronavirus pandemic, including tax-free fuel and decrease in VAT by 2%. [size=no report]

On 9 June 2020, employees of the Ballsh Oil Processing Plant held a protest in front of the prefecture of Fier town, demanding to resume work and receive their unpaid salaries during the coronavirus pandemic and dating back to 8 months. [size=no report]

On 8 June 2020, the Association of Albanian Public Transport organized a protest in Tirana, demanding help during the coronavirus pandemic, including tax-free fuel and decrease in VAT by 2%. [size=no report]
On 7 June 2020, residents held a protest in Fier against the rape of a schoolgirl by a guard and denounced sexual violence in schools. [size=no report]
On 5 June 2020, a group of tailors held a protest in front of a tax office in Durres, demanding emergency pay during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 5 June 2020, 70 female garment factory workers gathered outside a tax office in Tirana, protesting the lack of emergency payment during the coronavirus pandemic, worried they could not provide for their families. [size=70]
On 4 June 2020, mothers held a protest march in Sarande, denouncing the rape of a schoolgirl by a guard and sexual violence against minors. [size=no report]
On 4 June 2020, residents, mostly women, held a protest march in Korce, denouncing the rape of a schoolgirl by a guard and sexual violence against minors. [size=no report]
On 4 June 2020, young people held a protest in Durres against rape of a schoolgirl by a guard and denounced sexual violence in schools. [size=no report]
Radio and Televizioni Shqiptar; Exit Albania; Albanian Daily News

On 4 June 2020, thousands of citizens, mothers, journalists, artists and politicians held a protest march in Tirana against the rape of a schoolgirl by a guard and sexual violence in schools. [size=thousands]
PD: Democratic Party of Albania; Students (Albania)

On 3 June 2020, Democratic Party Youth Forum members held a protest in Tirana, demanding the resignation of the Minister of Education over sexual violence issues in schools, after a teenager was recently raped in school. [size=no report]
On 2 June 2020, dozens of residents held a protest in Tirana against the coronavirus measures, refusing to be vaccinated in the future and opposing 5G networks. [size=dozens]
On 30 May 2020, residents held a protest in Durres against a planned and controlled demolition of a building, fearing for their safety. [size=no report]
On 29 May 2020, over 100 employees of a shoe factory held a protest in Vlore, demanding government aid during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=over 100]

Around 27 May 2020 (as reported), two police officers assaulted and injured Roma youth in Tirana, trying to detain him as he was collecting cans near the urban waste bins. The Albanian Ombudsman launched an investigation into the case.
On 27 May 2020, employees of a factory held a protest in Berat, demanding stimulus payment promised by government during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 26 May 2020, public transport employees held a protest in front of the Vlore Tax Directorate, saying they had been out of work for almost three months but have not received government aid. [size=no report]
On 26 May 2020, residents held a protest in Durres, demanding clarification on the reconstruction of their houses, destroyed by the earthquake in November 2019. [size=no report]
On 25 May 2020, civil society and the Democratic Party held a protest in Kukes against the demolition of the National Theater in Tirana. [size=no report]

On 24 May 2020, civil society members staged a protest in Tirana, improvising an outdoor cafe and demanding Albania to reopen during the coronavirus pandemic and fines for violating the lockdown measures to be abolished. [size=no report]

On 24 May 2020, business owners held a protest in downtown Berat, refusing to close their establishments, as requested that weekend as a coronavirus precaution. Police argued with them and dispersed them. [size=no report]
Koha Jone; Radio and Televizioni Shqiptar

On 22 May 2020, activists staged a protest between the National Theater and the Ministry of Interior in Tirana, against the demolition of the theater and demanded imprisonment of the Prime Minister and the Mayor of Tirana, accusing them of corruption. [size=no report]

On 21 May 2020, artists and activists of the Alliance for the Protection of Theater staged a protest in front of the Special Anti-Corruption Prosecutor's Office (SPAK) in Tirana and demanded an independent investigation into the demolition of the National Theater over suspected law violations. [size=no report]
On 20 May 2020, residents held a protest in Durres against the demolition of the National Theater in Tirana and the alleged dictatorial style of the current government. [size=no report]
Labour Group (Albania); PD: Democratic Party of Albania
Koha Jone; AP; Radio and Televizioni Shqiptar; Albanian Daily News

On 20 May 2020, opposition supporters, including the Democratic party, activists and actors held a protest in Tirana over the demolition of the capital's National Theater building, demanding the government to rebuild it along the original plans. [size=no report]

On 20 May 2020, citizens and actors held a protest in Shkoder in support of the protest in Tirana against the demolition of the National Theater and the alleged dictatorship style by the current government. [size=no report]

On 19 May 2020, dozens of citizens and members of the Self-Determination (Vetevendosje) Center held a protest in front of the Tirana Court, in support of 8 activists arrested on May 17 during the protest against the demolition of the National Theater. [size=dozens]

On 18 May 2020, women laborers held a protest in Kruje, after their employer had closed operations after 4 coronavirus cases were discovered, which had caused them economic difficulties. [size=no report]
Labour Group (Albania); PD: Democratic Party of Albania

On 18 May 2020, hundreds to few thousand opposition supporters from the Democratic party and actors held a protest in Tirana, denouncing the demolition of the capital's National Theater building and pledging to continue protests until Prime Minister Edi Rama's government is overthrown. [size=hundreds to few thousand]

On 18 May 2020, actors held a protest in Shkoder in support of the protest in Tirana against the demolition of the National Theater and the alleged dictatorship style by the current government. [size=no report]
Labour Group (Albania); PD: Democratic Party of Albania

On 17 May 2020, opposition supporters, including the Democratic party, activists and actors clashed with police and pelted stones, trying to break through a security cordon at the main square in Tirana, angry over the demolition of the National Theatre. 2 people were injured and 37 were detained. [size=at least 37]
On 15 May 2020, 20 textile workers held a protest in Vlore, after their employer had dismissed them for demanding government aid during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=20]

On 15 May 2020, civil society activists held a protest at Skenderbeg square in Tirana, under the slogan 'Down with dictatorship,' referring to the coronavirus lockdown measures imposed by government that restrict their freedom. [size=no report]
On 14 May 2020, textile workers held a protest in Korce, demanding to receive government aid during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 14 May 2020, representatives of 60 businesses held a protest in Vore, seeking a review of the plan to rebuild the area damaged by the November 26 earthquake and demanded compensation to cover their losses. [size=at least 60]
On 14 May 2020, textile workers held a protest in Fier, demanding to receive government aid during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
On 11 May 2020, residents held a protest in Kruje against a proposed modernization of a historic neighborhood, worried about losing their cultural and historical heritage. [size=no report]
On 11 May 2020, taxi drivers held a protest in Tirana, as their street was converted to a bike lane and they were not able to work during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 9 May 2020, dozens of protesting citizens were dispersed by police at Skanderbeg Square in Tirana, where they gathered to commemorate Europe Day and protest against Prime Minister Edi Rama's alleged dictatorship, demanding to reopen the country during the coronavirus pandemic. 14 people were arrested. [size=dozens]

On 8 May 2020, textile manufacturing employees held a protest in Kucove for a second consecutive day, demanding to receive government aid during the coronavirus pandemic, and were dispersed by police. [size=no report]
On 7 May 2020, textile manufacturing employees held a protest in Kucove, demanding to receive government aid during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 7 May 2020, protesting residents were beaten up and dragged in police cars by dozens of police at Skanderbeg Square in Tirana, during their protest denouncing Prime Minister Edi Rama over his alleged authoritarian-style of governing and violation of human rights during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 7 May 2020, tour operators held a protest in Vlore against new draft regulations during the coronavirus pandemic, proposed by the Ministry of Tourism, which would prolong social distancing and impose a curfew. [size=no report]
On 7 May 2020, about 30 employees of textile businesses held a protest in Berat, demanding to receive government aid during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=about 30]
On 6 May 2020, doctors held a protest in Durres, demanding extra pay for essential workers, similar to the pay their colleagues in Tirana received during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
On 5 May 2020, workers of Albpetrol held a protest in Fier against the company's decision to lower their salaries and pay them the minimum salary for the country. [size=no report]
Albanian Daily News; Radio and Televizioni Shqiptar

On 4 May 2020, 30 employees of a shopping center held a protest in Fier, demanding to receive stimulus pay by the government, as they had been jobless for two months in the wake of the coronavirus. [size=30]

On 4 May 2020, 50 fishermen held a protest in Sarande, demanding to receive stimulus pay by the government, as they were facing bankruptcy in the wake of the coronavirus and complained of high oil prices. [size=50]

On 4 May 2020, dozens of fruit and vegetable traders held a protest in front of the city hall in Shkoder, demanding to resume work during the coronavirus pandemic, as their market was allowed to open. [size=dozens]

On 1 May 2020, oil workers staged a protest in Fier over not receiving government aid during the coronavirus pandemic upon the visit of the Albanian Prime Minister in town. Police dispersed the protest and took some of the protesters to the police station. [size=no report]
On 1 May 2020, dozens of fishermen held a protest in Durres, discontent with artificially high oil prices, which they had to pay to fuel their boats during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=dozens]
On 28 April 2020, 118 employees of a tailor shop staged a protest in Korce over not qualifying to receive government aid during the coronavirus epidemic. [size=118]
On 27 April 2020, about 30 employees of a tailor shop staged a protest in Fier, as they had remained unemployed since their factory was closed due to the coronavirus lockdown. [size=about 30]
On 27 April 2020, vendors of Zdrale market held a protest in Shkoder demanding to reopen the market during the coronavirus lockdown, as they feared losing their livelihood. [size=no report]
Albanian Daily News; Radio and Televizioni Shqiptar
On 24 April 2020, farmers held a protest in Topoje, saying that they had been forgotten by government and not awarded any financial relief during the coronavirus epidemic. [size=no report]
Radio and Televizioni Shqiptar; Albanian Daily News

On 24 April 2020, a group of textile workers held a protest in Durres, as they had not received their salaries and the textile company they work for had closed due to the coronavirus lockdown. [size=no report]
On 22 April 2020, traders held a protest in Berat, demanding stimulus pay during the coronavirus epidemic. [size=no report]
Albanian Daily News; Radio and Televizioni Shqiptar
On 20 April 2020, about 150 oil workers held a protest in Fier, demanding economic relief during the coronavirus epidemic. [size=about 150]
On 17 April 2020, Roma citizens held a protest in Kamez, demanding government aid for food and paying bills during the coronavirus lockdown. [size=no report]
On 17 April 2020, industrial market traders held a protest in Durres, saying they had not received any economic assistance during the coronavirus lockdown. [size=no report]

On 17 April 2020, traders held a protest in Vlore against the government decision to close a market in town during the coronavirus lockdown, which did not comply with hygiene standards. [size=no report]

As reported on 16 April 2020, police officers assaulted and pushed a woman to the ground in Vlore for violating the coronavirus lockdown and leaving her apartment without permission. Former Prime Minister Sali Berisha shared a video of the incident, appealing citizens to protest police violence.
On 15 April 2020, traders held a protest in Vlore against the government decision to close the farmer's market in town during the coronavirus lockdown. [size=no report]
On 15 April 2020, Roma citizens held a protest outside the municipal building in Elbasan, demanding government aid for food and paying bills during the coronavirus lockdown. [size=no report]

On Dec.8 2018, there were tensions at the Greek-Albanian border of Kakavia between Greek and Albanian citizens. A group of 98 Greek citizens was trying to cross the border in order to attend the memorial service of Konstantine Katsifas, a Greek ethnic man that was killed in late October in a gunbattle with Albanian Police in South Albania. Albanian authorities tried to deter them with strict checks at the border. At the same time, Albanian citizens formed a human chain in a symbolic protest against a bus with Greek citizens intending to travel to Bularat, the village where Katsifas was killed. In return, the Greek group tried to form a chain to stop Albanian buses from entering Greece but Greek authorities pushed them back. Among the Greeks denied entry to Albania was the personal guard of a New Democracy MP that was carrying his firearm without the necessary license and was subsequently arrested.

On Dec.8 2018, in Bularat, South Albania, during the memorial service for Konstantine Katsifas, a Greek ethnic man that was killed in late October in a gunbattle with Albanian Police, Albanian nationalists demonstrated with the slogan 'Let's save Albania' in a counter-gathering as they said against Greek nationalism.

On August 30, 2018: Unidentified attacker shot with automatic weaponry at journalist Claudia Lala's home in Tirana. The journalist's children, parents and brother were at home at the time of the attack. No injuries were reported. Lala was known for reporting about organized crime and justice for more than a decade and it was suspected that the attack was linked to her work as a journalist.

On August 30, 2018: Journalists and representatives of the Albanian media, joined by civil society organizations and residents of Tirana, held a protest at the People's Heroes Square in Tirana to support journalist Claudiana Lala over an attack on her home. The protesters demanded the institutions to clarify the case and bring the perpetrators to justice.

On August 29, 2018: Residents of the Memlisht village in Pogradec protested against the operation of an iron and nickel mine, situated at a close vicinity of their houses. The protesters contested the legality of the permit for exploitation.

On August 20, 2018: Dozens of nurses protested at the Hospital Center in Tirana for a parking payment, which applied exclusively to them. The protesters contested the fee that doctors, for instance, did not have to pay.

On July 31, 2018: Residents of Ballsh protested against pollution from the gas pipes of the Ballsh factory, which resulted in the posioning of a worker. Protesters said there were also cases of children being poisoned.

Intellinews; Radio and Televizioni Shqiptar; Albanian Daily News
On May 16, 2018: A group of government opposition demonstrated in Tirana calling for the resignation of interior minister Fatmir Xhafaj, whose brother had been convicted of drug trafficking.

On May 13, 2018: LGBT organisations held their seventh annual pride event and marched along the main Martyrs of the Nation Boulevard demonstrating against what they believe is widespread homophobia in Albania. Protesters threw eggs at the Interior Ministry.

On May 5, 2018: Farmers from 16 villages near Fier and Berat regions blocked the Lushnje-Berat road, demonstrating against the government subsidies scheme, bad infrastructure and markets for their produce.

On May 3, 2018: Gjirokastra Deputy Mayor, Aurel Lapa, and Gjirokastra prefecture topographer, Shefqet Alikaj, fought each other due to an alleged concern over competence to administer Gjirokastra's pastures. Both officials were hospitalized after the fight and it was reported that Lapa had hematomas on the face.
On May 1, 2018: Miners protested in Tirana demanding a change in their status to have more support and rights, as well as increase the work safety conditions.
On May 1, 2018: Taxi drivers protested in Vlore on the International Workers Day, urging the government to stop illegal taxis and provide better working conditions.
On Apr. 30, 2018: Bread producers in Albanian protested against the increase of energy prices in their bakeries.
On Apr. 26, 2018: Theater artists protested in front of the Minicipality in Tirana against the demolition of the historic National Theater building.
On Apr. 23, 2018: Theater artists protested in Tirana against the demolition of the historic National Theater building.

On Apr. 20, 2018: Citizens and members of the opposition democrat party threw smoke grenades and fireworks at the Shkodra's Appeal Court in Shkoder, demanding the release of the 11 demonstrators arrested for the Nation's Road riot.
On Apr. 19, 2018: Supporters of the 11 demonstrators arrested for the demonstration on the Nation's Road in Kukes protested in front of the Kukes Municipal Council.
On Apr. 16, 2018: Small businesses protested in Fier against a new VAT scheme, which would increase the tax they paid.
On Apr. 16, 2018: Actors protested in Tirana against the planned demolition of the National Theater, which also prevented them to enter the building.

On Apr. 12, 2018: MPs of the Democratic party protested in the Parliament in Tirana with slogans 'release the citizens of Kukesi' and 'arrest the criminials within Parliament.' No incidents were reported.

On Apr. 8, 2018: Citizens from Tirana and Kukes protested in front of the Government in Tirana carrying slogans 'Arrest Me Too' - urging freedom for the eleven citizens arrested in an earlier protest over a new toll on the highway to Kukes.
Radio and Televizioni Shqiptar; Albanian Daily News; TV Klan

On Apr. 7, 2018: Supporters of the 11 demonstrators arrested for the protest on the Nation's Road in Kukes protested in front of the Prime Minister's building in Tirana. Two democrat MPs threw flour on Prime Minster Edi Rama, while he was drinking water, and were immediately expelled.

On Apr. 5, 2018: Citizens blocked a road junction in Elbasan protesting against the introduction of a toll road. The protest was organized by the main opposition Democratic Party and protesters also demanded the government to resign.

On Apr. 5, 2018: Citizens blocked a road junction in Lushnje protesting against the introduction of a toll road. The protest was organized by the main opposition Democratic Party and protesters also demanded the government to resign.

On Apr. 5, 2018: Citizens blocked a road junction in Milot protesting against the introduction of a toll road. The protest was organized by the main opposition Democratic Party and protesters also demanded the government to resign.
Albanian Daily News; Intellinews; TV Klan

On Apr. 5, 2018: Citizens blocked a road junction in Vlore protesting against the introduction of a toll road. The protest was organized by the main opposition Democratic Party and protesters also demanded the government to resign.
On Apr. 5, 2018: Supporters of the 11 demonstrators arrested for the protest on the Nation's Road in Kukes continued to protest in the city center demanding the release of the arrested.
On Apr. 4, 2018: Workers from a former refinery in Ballsh protested demanding the payment of their wages dating back to 15 months.

On Apr. 4, 2018: Supporters and relatives of the 23 demonstrators arrested for the protest on the Nation's Road continued to demonstrate and blocked the road towards Tirana Court demanding their release. During the demonstration, democratic MPs tried to forcefully enter the Tirana Court and clashed with police officers. One of the democrat MPs was lightly injured.
Radio and Televizioni Shqiptar; Albanian Daily News
On Apr. 3, 2018: Supporters and relatives of the 23 demonstrators arrested for the protest on the Nation's Road continued to protest in front of the Tirana Police Directorate demanding their release.
Radio and Televizioni Shqiptar; Albanian Daily News

On Apr. 2, 2018: Supporters and relatives of the 23 demonstrators arrested for the protest on the Nation's Road demonstrated for 24 hours in front of the Tirana Police Directorate demanding their release.

On Apr. 1, 2018: Relatives of arrested demonstrators against the introduction of a toll on motorway linking the Albania with Kosovo protested in Kukes demanding their release and declaring they would never pay a tax for using the Nation's Road.
On Mar. 31, 2018: More than a 100 Kosovo truck drivers and Albanian shopkeepers protested in the town of Kukes against the introduction of a toll on motorway linking the Albania with Kosovo.
Albanian Daily News; AFP; Xinhua; AP

On Mar. 31, 2018: Several hundred Albanians demonstrated against the introduction of a toll on motorway linking the Albania with Kosovo. The demonstrators pelted police with stones and destroyed toll booths before setting them on fire near the border crossing of Morina, Kukes. Around 24 police officers and demonstrators were injured during the clashes.
On Mar. 30, 2018: Students organized a protest in Tirana against professors who took bribe in exchange for passing grades.

On Mar. 22, 2018: Albanians protested in Vlora against the maritime border agreement with Greece, which would grant Greece additional territory, and against the April 7 meeting, scheduled in Korce between Prime Minister Rama and Greek Prime Minister Tsipras.

On Mar. 21, 2018: Miners demonstrated in front of the prime minister's office in Tirana demanding to have their miner status recognized by the state. Miners and police clashed as the former attempted to enter the prime minister' premises.
On Mar. 19, 2018: Dozens of workers at the Ballsh Oil Plant, supported by Albanian worker unions, gathered in another protest to demand the payment of 15 overdue salaries.
On Mar. 18, 2018: Supporters of the arrested mayor of Lezhe, Fran Frrokaj, protested in their city demanding the accusations of approporation of assets were false.
On Mar. 8, 2018: Albanian women gathered in Skanderbeg Square in Tirana upon the International Women's Day protesting against gender-based issues, such as violence against women and unequal pay.

On Mar. 5, 2018: Environmental activists held a rally in Tirana in protest against various construction works in protected and tourist areas. Protesters said they were trying to stop the irreversible destruction of Albanian nature by private firms that violate laws and corrupt judges who helped them.
On Mar. 5, 2018: Workers from the Fieri and Vlora Bypass protested in front of Parliament in Tirana urging the government to provide a solution for their unpaid salaries dating back to 16 months.

On Mar. 4, 2018: Citizens, environmentalists and residents of the villages of Kukes, Topojan and Novojse, gathered for a peaceful protest on the 'Nazi Witnesses' boulevard in Kukes to oppose the construction of hydropower plants in the Valbona valley and national park.
Albanian Daily News; Intellinews; The National Herald
On Feb. 24, 2018: A few thousand Cham Albanians held a protest in front of the Greek embassy in Tirana insisting that Athens apologize for what they called genocide against them after the WWII.
On Feb. 22, 2018: The workers of two subcontractor companies in the Fier-Vlora bypass protested demandingr unpaid salaries.
On Feb. 18, 2018: Cleaners in the city of Pogradec protested against the firm that had a contract with the municipality for cleaning the city, saying it had underpaid their wages.
On Feb. 17, 2018: Albanian civic groups and citizens protested in Fier against the maritime agreement with Greece, demanding full transparency by government on the pact.
On Feb. 15, 2018: The workers of two sub-contracting companies protested in front of the parliament in Tirana demanding to receive unpaid salaries dating back to 18 months.

On Feb. 15, 2018: Citizens from Gerdec protested in Tirana for justice regarding better working conditions at the arms factory in Gerdec, including increase in pensions, as well as Minister Mediu's resignation due to confrontations with the judiciary.

On Feb. 12, 2018: National theater artists forcibly entered the theater after a confrontation with security guards. The artists demonstrated against a new draft for art and culture, requesting to meet with the Minister of culture and receive more transparency on the issue.

On Feb. 10, 2018: Hundreds of civic groups protested in front of Albanian Government in Tirana, seeking information about maritime agreement with Greece and whether Albania has accepted the expansion of Greek water by 12 nautical miles in the Ionian Sea.

On Feb. 10, 2018: Residents of the Orman village in Korce protested in the center of the village, discontent they did not have a market for their produce due to unfair competition on a regional level.
On Feb. 8, 2018: Albanian civic groups and citizens protested in Tirana against the maritime agreement with Greece, demanding full transparency by government on the pact.
On Feb. 8, 2018: Albanian miners from Korce gathered in front of the parliament in Tirana to protest asking for revision of their pensions and status, warning of protest escalation.

On Feb. 7, 2018: The employees of the oil Plant in Ballsh and members of their families gathered in front of the prefecture in Fier to demand unpaid salaries and implementation of the new legislative changes related to their work status.
On Feb. 6, 2018: An explosion occurred in a building at 'Muhamed Gjollesha' street, presumably part of a series of anarchist attacks this night. No casualties were reported.

On Feb. 6, 2018: An explosion with TNT occurred at a pharmacy in Tirana, owned by the father of the Minister of Interior Affairs, Saimir Tahiri, presumably part of a series of anarchist attacks this night. No casualties were reported. The explosion was condemned as a terrorist act by Prime Minister Rama.
On Feb. 6, 2018: An explosion occurred near the apartment of the former chief of police, Alfred Numani, presumably part of a series of anarchist attacks this night. No casualties were reported.

On Feb. 3, 2018: Albanian opposition protested in front of the Prime Minister's office in Tirana against a potential maritime border deal with Greece, which according to them would give Greece an extra territory of 12 miles.
PD: Democratic Party of Albania; LSI: Socialist Movement for Integration

On January 27, Albania's two main opposition parties, DP and SMI, as well as other smaller parties protested in Tirana to call for the resignation of Prime Minister Edi Rama. More than 10.000 protesters participated. No violence was reported.

On Jan. 23, 2018: Tirana residents, mostly students,organized a march to honor Ariela Murati, a young woman who was shot dead on Sunday after rejecting the advances of a former classmate. Protesters called on authorities to urgently take extra measures to address violence against women.

On Jan. 20, 2018: A group of Albanian activists protested in Korce in front of the hotel where Greek and Albanian Foreign Ministers met. The protesters urged Greek Minister Kotzias to respond about the death of hundreds of Albanians in Greek prisons.

On Feb. 16, 2018: Residents of the Verri village in Fier protested in front of the parliament in Tirana against the construction of an incinerator 700 meters away from their houses. The protesters were also discontent that the incinerator would be located in the middle of a farming field.
On Jan. 12, 2-18: Albanian citizens protested during the meeting of Government in 2018 in Lezha demanding that government deals better with corruption and bad infrastucture.
